SMC_GetTravelTime (FB)
SMC_GetTravelTime (FB)
Â¶
FUNCTION_BLOCK SMC_GetTravelTime
Returns when the axis will pass through a given position in
a given direction.
The function block returns the duration after a single call with
Enable=TRUE, provided no error has occurred and the position will
be reached during the configured forecast duration.
An error is returned in the following situations:
SMC_AXIS_IS_NO_AXIS_REF if an invalid axis is passed to the
function block.
SMC_FB_CALLED_FROM_WRONG_TASK if the function block is not called in
the bus task of the axis.
SMC_AXIS_NOT_FOLLOWING_SETVALUES if the drive is not under control of
SoftMotion, e.g. during quick stop, drive controlled homing or
controller mode SMC_nocontrol.
SMC_WRONG_CONTROLLER_MODE if the controller mode is not SMC_position
or SMC_velocity.
Note
Reading the duration requires setting a forecast duration using
SMC_SetForecast
.  The
Axis
must be within the forecast
duration of the
Position
for the
Duration
output to be valid.
If the axis does not move, then Valid is FALSE even if the axis
is exactly at the given position.
While the calculated
Duration
has sub-cycle accuracy, a position
that is passed twice in one cycle will not be detected.
InOut:
Scope
Name
Type
Initial
Comment
Inout Const
Axis
AXIS_REF_SM3
Reference to the axis
Input
Enable
BOOL
Get the duration continuously while enabled.
Position
LREAL
The axis position.
Direction
SMC_CAMTAPPETTYPE
SMC_CAMTAPPETTYPE.TAPPET_all
The direction from which the position needs to be passed.
If the position is reached from a different direction,
it will not be returned by this function block.
ValueSource
MC_SOURCE
MC_SOURCE.SET
Determines whether the duration is based on when the position
is reached by the set position sent to the drive, or the
actual position inside the drive.
With MC_SOURCE.SET, the duration is based on the set position
at the beginning of the current bus task cycle.
With MC_SOURCE.ACT, an additional dead time between the set positions
and the time when this set position is reached by the drive,
is added to the swicth event time.
If you set this input to MC_SOURCE.ACT, make sure the dead time
between set and actual values is correct.  The dead time in cycles
can be set by writing parameter 1070, or in the SoftMotion drive
configuration editor.
Note: the value MC_SOURCE.SAVE behaves identically to MC_SOURCE.SET.
Output
Valid
BOOL
Whether the duration output is valid.
Duration
LREAL
The duration in seconds until the position is passed, relative to
the start of the current cycle.
The duration has sub-cycle accuracy.
A value of 0s means that the position has been reached with the
position at the end of the previous cycle.  A value equal to the
task interval means that the position will be reached at the end
of this cycle.
Error
BOOL
Whether an error has occurred.
ErrorId
SMC_ERROR
The error identifier.

rows.Name: Enable
rows.Comment: Get the duration continuously while enabled.

rows:

it will not be returned by this function block.
